Name: Graham Perrin
AboutMe:
Technical interests

  • Mac user since December 1992, a pleasure for twenty-one years
  • AppleSeed programme member 405 in 2009 – I departed after five years when some essentials within the OS X Human Interface Guidelines (HIG) were abandoned by Apple for for the mashed-up development of OS X 10.10 Yosemite
  • I don't expect pre-release OS X 10.11 El Capitan to put things right, so it's a slow farewell from me to the Mac – http://tinyurl.com/farewellmac
  • switching to PC-BSD, which uses the OpenZFS storage system and file system – I'll continue to use OS X 10.9.5 Mavericks in Oracle VirtualBox (probably without Apple hardware), Debian Linux in a jail, and so on
  • planning to use Bluetooth-enabled hearing aids with parallel pairing capability (context)
  • Yotaphone 2 is very appealing but before purchase I'd like to handle one, locally – in Brighton or Hove
  • Light Phone and Janus One are appealing complements, but I should not expect such things to work with the swipe features that are associated with Unify Circuit.

Day job

University of Brighton

IT support and related activities for:

  • CENTRIM, the Centre for Research in Innovation Management (City campus – Edward Street building, five minutes' walk from the innovation quarter for Circus Street)
  • Brighton Business School (Moulsecoomb campus and beyond).

Some other interests

  • Overcoming both tinnitus and the side-effects of tinnitus
  • relaxation and meditation – within the constraints of tinnitus
  • self-hypnosis.
